definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc

sentences.english: In Watergate, the break-in didn't affect the outcome of the election.
sentences.chinese: 在水門事件中，闖入行爲並未影響選舉的結果。

sentences.english: Califano said Watergate would bring a Democratic revival.
sentences.chinese: 卡利法諾說，水門事件將幫助民主黨人東山再起。
尼克松因爲水門事件辭職。

sentences.english: He is reviled for his Watergate lies.
sentences.chinese: 他就是因水門事件而被痛斥的。

sentences.english: You're saying all that goes into Watergate ?
sentences.chinese: 你是說所有這些都歸到水門事件？
尼克松阻礙水門事件的調查。

sentences.english: The Times article was one of a series of articles on Whitewater.
sentences.chinese: 《紐約時報》的文章只是白水門事件的系列報道之一。
